comment.body:
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has been open for 4 days with no activity.
Unfortunately, our resources are limited and we can not always take the time to respond to requests about websites that are not popular enough. The issue will be closed if no further activity occurs.
Please note, that AdGuard Filters is an open-source project that is used by different content blockers and we welcome contributions. If you have some technical knowledge about how websites work, you are welcome to create a pull request following [these instructions](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md).

comment.body:
The message said that the server had overloaded.
By the way, you need to enable List-KR filter instead of YousList to block advertisement on the website.

그 메시지는 서버가 과부하되었다는 내용입니다.
그나저나, 웃긴대학에 있는 광고를 차단학기 위해 YousList 대신에 List-KR 필터를 활성화하셔야 합니다.

issue.title: zoechip.com

labels.name: A: In progress
labels.description: Work on the issue is in progress

labels.name: A: Waiting for data
labels.description: Waiting for more information from the user

issue.body:
### Prerequisites

- [X] This site DOES NOT contain sexually explicit material, otherwise use [NSFW-specific form](./new?template=bug_report_NSFW.yml);
- [X] Filters were updated before reproducing an issue;
- [X] AdGuard product version is up-to-date;
- [X] Browser version is up-to-date;
- [X] If the site or app is broken, disabling AdGuard protection resolves an issue.

### What product do you use?

AdGuard for iOS

### AdGuard version

4.4.6

### What type of problem have you encountered?

Missed ads or ad leftovers

### Which browser(s) do you use?

Safari

### Which device do you use?

Mobile

### Where is the problem encountered?

https://www3.zoechip.com/

### What filters do you have enabled?

AdGuard Base filter, AdGuard Mobile Ads filter

### What Stealth Mode options do you have enabled?

_No response_

### Add your comment and screenshots

1. <comment>The inline script userule suggested to me did work for windows adguard extension ||zoechip.com/|$inline-script,important

it however did not work on Adguard IOS

of which neither did this userule work on IOS either

||zoechip.com/|$csp=script-src 'self' 'unsafe-eval' http: https: data: blob: mediastream: filesystem:,important

So for windows the redirect is blocked for IOS its not

2. Screenshots
<details><summary>Screenshot 1:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/124982114/73ec7173-71b2-45ab-8304-e48e99d421ab)


</details>
![image](https://github.com/AdguardTeam/AdguardFilters/assets/124982114/1f82d7dd-ddd5-443b-8b4a-6059e62d4ea4)


<details><summary>Screenshot N:</summary>

<!-- paste screenshot here -->

</details>Also im trying to learn your adblock and the custom filters

So im gonna take a shot here would these filter rules of which right now are not put correctly therefore will not block

http://ads.example.org.us/ad1.gif
    http://example.com/redirect/http://ads.example.org/
    
    Would they block if they were typed this way instead?
    
    http://ads.example.org/us/ad1.gif
    http://example.com/http:ads.example.org/redirect
    
    or would it be http://ads.example.org/redirect?
    
    
    meaning there was never supposed to be a .com only a .org because in this example these are orginization websites?
    
    or is there an example.com commerical website and a example.org orginzation website
    
    of where if what i understand is correct the addresses of websites go first of http://example.com/http:ads.example.org/redirect?
    
    
    or would it actually be http://example.com/redirect
    
    and http://ads.example.org/redirect
    
    meaning they would be two seperate filter rules?



Im trying to understand this!


If im completely wrong on why these would not be blocked


than i dont comprehend your websites explanation on filter rules at all


### Privacy

- [X] I agree to follow this condition

comment.body: @BlazDT oh i figured out now how to address a specific person also i think @jellizaveta resolved it with their userrule but in case it no longer works i will def try yours
